newsitem.title: UK: Britain's Tomkins hedges dollar profits.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Tomkins hedges dollar profits.

text.p: British engineering-to-baking group Tomkins Plc said on Friday it put its annual foreign exchange cover in place to hedge its vulnerability to currency fluctuations.
Tomkins, which has its largest exposure to the U.S. dollar, said the cover taken out for the current year ended in May 1998 protected profits at a rate of one pound equalling $1.62.
Under the previous cover, one pound equalled $1.52.
Many British exporters have seen their profits hit by the continued strength of sterling. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
